subject: RE: [junit] Re: Test Grouping/Partitioning
msgSnippet: ... build) ... etc) Those are definitely nice benefits.  I m having a hard time visualizing what Nightly.java is, though.  A test suite which runs anything
messageBody:
> > As far as the categories go, I would like to see a simple
> method-level
> > annotation that looks like this:
> >
> > @TestGroups={"nightly", "quick", "bug"}
>
> Any takers on identifying categories with classes?
>
> @TestGroups({Nightly.class, Quick.class, Bug.class})
>
> I'm thinking:
>
> - auto-completion
> - refactoring
> - easy hook for running (just run Nightly.class to get the Nightly
build)
> - easy place for further customization (@BeforeClass, @AfterClass,
etc)

Those are definitely nice benefits. I'm having a hard time visualizing
what Nightly.java is, though. A test suite which runs anything
annotated with itself? An empty class?


Todd.
